Lexicon.label: A Sample of the Old English WordNet

disgrace, scandal, shame, mockery, insult, reproach, scorn
deceit, fraud, treachery, sin, evil, wickedness, crime
vile, bad, wicked, criminal, impious, filthy, abonimable
foul, unclean, impure, vile, corrupt, rotten
to disgrace, to put to shame
to disfigure, spoil, injure, mar, dejile, corrupt.
to confound, abash, bring to shame
to confound, confuse, disturb, throw into disorder
Humiliation, abasement, disgrace, contempt, injury, harm, loss
to pour upon, suffuse, flood, overwhelm

to disgrace, put to shame, cover with confusion
in a manner that causes harm or trouble, grievously, miserably
in a way that brings shame or affront, with insult or ignominy
